body: I think the current rate logic is correct, the numerator is the count of [firstReportedError](https://github.com/apache/skywalking-data-collect-protocol/blob/master/browser/BrowserPerf.proto#L100), and the denominator is the count of [BrowserPerfData](https://github.com/apache/skywalking-data-collect-protocol/blob/master/browser/BrowserPerf.proto#L42).
`isDenominator` is true only when `trafficCategory == BrowserAppTrafficCategory.NORMAL`. So, some `BrowserAppTraffic` doesn't count as denominator.
um mistake operator... how to reopen it... I think current logic is very misleading.
@Fine0830  We should check whether [skywalk-client-js](https://github.com/apache/skywalking-client-js) handle `firstReportedError` correctly ?

> @Fine0830 We should check whether [skywalk-client-js](https://github.com/apache/skywalking-client-js) handle `firstReportedError` correctly ?

Uh.... I believe it is correct. If there is an incorrect scene, please let me know.

@zhyyu Could you check the raw data?  Is there a case, a single page reports error twice?

@Fine0830 Every PV, there should be 0 or 1(firstReportedError=true) error.

> when the errors count were two times to normal pv

The key point is here, this should not happen. @zhyyu Could you check your env, and find out why?
@zhyyu Which version of `skywalking-client-js` are you using ?

@zhyyu I was confused by the same thing, but after digging deeper, the `BrowserAppTraffic` are generated by 2 sources.

* org.apache.skywalking.oap.server.receiver.browser.provider.parser.performance.listener.SourceBuilder
* org.apache.skywalking.oap.server.receiver.browser.provider.parser.errorlog.listener.SourceBuilder

Performance's builder should generate `status==normal` for all pages, and errorlog's builder reports `status== FIRST_ERROR`

If the result is incorrect, I want to check, when page occurs error, whether
1. `performance` data gets reported
2. `errorlog` data only includes one and only one `FIRST_ERROR` status record.
I guess here is a single page case, and it didn't handle PV like this(https://github.com/apache/skywalking-client-js#spa-page). If so, the pages PV will be left out.
The docker image is update on Sep 12, but the fuzzy query bug is fixed on [Sep 14](https://github.com/apache/iotdb/pull/3953). So some UTs cannot pass. We have to wait IoTDB version 0.12.3 release.

Do you have GitHub host dev image? It is fine to use it for testing. We just need to indicate release version on doc, and update test image version later.
SkyWalking is using this mode, because waiting for another version could be long and face new bugs.
Take a reference from here. https://github.com/orgs/apache/packages?repo_name=skywalking
I will package a IoTDB dev docker image later.

SkyWalking is building dev image automatically for every default branch commit, using commitid as tag.

commit, using commitid as tag.

Hi @kezhenxu94 ,

I found that the JDBC driver of ClickHouse is implemented using HTTP protocol, so it will be handled by HTTPClient Plugin. And it can't be recognized as an db span through trace information. It looks like an ordinary http request, and the request path is always `/`, because of the sql is in the request body.

This plugin will intercept JDBC methods and insert a correct db span, but there are still other wrong type spans produced by HttpClient plugin, how should I exclude these? Any ideas?
Is HttpClient in sync or async? If it is in sync, it is easy. Adding an exit span to the JDBC implementation, than its exit span disappears automatically.

> Is HttpClient in sync or async? If it is in sync, it is easy. Adding an exit span to the JDBC implementation, than its exit span disappears automatically.

It is in sync, I will try it. Thanks for reply.
We will need 8.8.1 to include this fix.
Let's wait for https://github.com/apache/skywalking/pull/7826 ready and merged. Then @kezhenxu94 could cut the release first. After merging, maybe we will face conflicts in GHA control file.

Sure, we will be on China National Day vacation, and we are doing 8.8.1 release as a hot fix release.
Feel free to send pull request to 8.9.0

I also found this problem, the httpasyncclient-4.x-plugin did not take effect most of the time.
The connections are reused from the pool, so the `SessionRequest` will not be instantiated.

I am afraid not, 10T for ElasticSearch is not a big issue. We don't have anyone working on hbase or similar tech stack.
SkyWalking is an APM, with incoming native swlf-built database. We don't like idea about using big data for operation team.
